info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 12:27AM EDT until March 27 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Transylvania. * WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance to Minor flooding is ongoing across central and eastern Transylvania County. Minor flooding is defined as flooding of parks, greenways, farmland, nurseries, woodlands, and low-water crossings up to 2-4 feet deep as well as inundation of secondary roads and campgrounds up to 1-2 feet deep. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1208 AM EDT, Heavy rain has ended across Transylvania County. However, periods of moderate to heavy rain over the past 24 hours resulted in storm-total accumulations of 3-5 inches, with isolated totals reaching 6 inches across the county. This has caused significant rises on area streams, including the upper French Broad River, Davidson River, and Little River and associated tributaries. While smaller streams have crested and are receding below bankfull levels, larger mainstem streams, including the Little River and French Broad River, are still rising. This will cause nuisance to Minor flooding of adjacent low-lying areas downstream of Rosman to Brevard to Etowah along the French Broad River, nuisance flooding along the Davidson River near Pisgah Forest, and nuisance to Minor flooding around Penrose and Crab Creek along the Little River. Flooding is expected to persist into early Thursday morning, especially along the Little River near Penrose, therefore the Flood Warning will be extended. The French Broad River near Rosman has crested below the Action/Advisory Stage of 7.0 feet, peaking at 6.1 feet at 10pm. The river will continue to fall tonight. The Davidson River near Pisgah Forest crested at the Action/Advisory Stage of 4.5 feet at 10pm. The river will continue to fall slowly over the next few hours then fall more rapidly into early Thursday morning. The Little River near Penrose is at 9.64 feet and rising. Action/Advisory Stage is 7.5 feet. Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. Little River is expected to continue to rise steadily for the next several hours and will likely crest below 10.5 feet overnight tonight into early Thursday morning. A reasonable worst case crest of 11 feet is possible. At 10.0 feet: Minor Flood Stage. Farmland on either side of the Little River near Cascade Lake Rd and Merrill Ln is experiencing up to 24" of inundation. Cascade Lake Rd and Merrill Ln are experiencing inundation up to 12-18" deep. Many ditches and small streams in the vicinity will likely be flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brevard, Rosman, Looking Glass, Dupont State Forest, Connestee, Penrose, Little River In Transylvania County, Balsam Grove, North Transylvania and Cedar Mountain. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
